body.p:
Scottsville Nov 24 1862
To his Excellency
James F. Robinson
Govenor of the Comwlth of Kentucky

Your Petitions W T. Garrison and Jordan Evans represent to your excellency that on the day of 1862, they were tried and convicted by a jury of Allen County before S. L Mayan J. P. for said county and fined Twenty seven Dollars each for a breach of the Peace. They state that they are very poor men & have familys to support and that they cannot pay said fine and do their familys justice. They say that said crime of which they were charged consisted in loud and boisterous talking that they were not engaged in a fight and affray. They prays that your excellency will remit the portion of said fine going to the state and by so doing your petitioners state it will be a great act of mercy & leniency.

Jordon ^his X mark^ Evans
W. T. Garrison
Attest Jno J Gelward
S. L. Morgan, Justice of the Peace
